Subhead: Amid a wave of anti-migrant sentiment in the US and growing ties between Moscow and Washington, 64 Russians were sent back to their country from Arizona. Upon arrival in Moscow, the men quickly received military draft notices.

Title: Amnesty International accuses Hamas of crimes against humanity during and after the October 7 attack
Subhead: The international organization said the mass killing in 2023 that left 1,221 dead amounted 'to the crime against humanity of extermination.' The crimes listed included murder, extermination, imprisonment, torture, enforced disappearance, rape and 'other forms of sexual violence.'

Title: The power gems on display in Paris
Subhead: Opals and cameos of Empress Josephine, an emerald tiara once worn by Queen Victoria, diamond aigrettes of maharajas:  At the Hôtel de la Marine, the exhibition 'Dynastic Jewels' offers a rare glimpse into the jewelry collections of historical figures.

Title: PSG mulls locations for new home, pending local elections
Subhead: After several years of unsuccessful talks with City Hall regarding the purchase of the Parc des Princes, the club is conducting in-depth studies in Massy and Poissy, two cities in the Paris region, for the construction of a new home ground.

Illegal crosses in French public spaces reignite debates over church-state separation
Subhead: Calvaries installed on public land in towns in the Alps, on the Mediterranean coast and on the island of Corsica, sometimes with the help of far-right identitarian movements, have rekindled long-standing tensions around France's 1905 law separating churches and state.

Title: Achille Mbembe, philosopher: 'We will see more coups d'état in Africa'
Subhead: Following the attempted coup in Benin on December 7, the Cameroonian philosopher and political scientist Achille Mbembe believes that Africa is now a continent where 'force and power are stripped down to the essentials.'

Title: France's far-right Rassemblement National wants to reopen brothels
Subhead: MP Jean-Philippe Tanguy, who is preparing a bill to create cooperatives managed by sex workers themselves, says penalizing customers has worsened the situation of sex workers.
